results.title: Colonial America in the eighteenth century
results.brief_description: Describes life in America in the 75 years preceding the Revolutionary War. Discusses the evolution of the American political system, laws, social customs and economic system. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Colonel Wolodyjowski [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Polish Corporation for Film Production and Jerzy Hoffman
results.brief_description: Polish documentary filmmaker Jerzy Hoffman brought an aura of realism to the sweeping historical epic ‘Colonel Wolodyjowski’, aka Pan Wolodyjowski, an adaptation of the final part of a trilogy of patriotic novels by nobel prize winning Henry Sienkiewicz. Set in the 17th century, this film details the bloody struggle on the Eastern border of Poland at the time of the Turkish invasion. It recounts the legend of Pan Wolodyjowski and his friend Ketling, who, after bitterly defending the Kamieniec Castle against the Turks and upon the declaration of surrender took drastic action to state and resist the dishonour and devastation of the surrender. An adventurous tale of heroism, spectacular duels, everlasting friendships and the nation’s past glories and defeats evoked in a patriotic manner for people to identify with the fictitious heroes, and believe in the resurrection of Poland. Very successful in its Polish release, this film made little impact internationally but as an epic representing Polish history and literature it does make its mark. Cast includes Tadeusz Lomnicki, Magdelena Zawadzka and Daniel Olbrychski. In Polish with English subtitles.

results.title: Colombo Plan and you
results.creator_credit: Department of Foreign Affairs and National Economic Council
results.brief_description: Tells something of the work being done by the Colombo Plan and of the assistance being given, by Australia amongst other nations, by means of the donation of machinery and the provision of technical advise. Focuses on the Philippines which is both a donor and a recipient of Colombo Plan and other forms of technical and economic assistance.

results.title: Colombian gold: the sweat of the sun
results.brief_description: Provides a history of Colombia. Catalogues the destruction carried out by the Spanish conquistadores, the influence of the Spanish and Catholic Church and the way of life of the various tribes. The gold artefacts and their production techniques are explained by Clemica Plazas de Nieto, curator of the Museo del Oro, Bogota.

results.title: Colombia and Venezuela
results.creator_credit: ERPI Classroom Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Four sub-regions are determined by the topography of these two South American countries; the climate, the industries, and the population of these are studied - farming, shipping, mining and agriculture - with stress on the contrast between cities and countryside. The different types of people and their work, and the world trading economy of these countries are simply represented with the aid of animation.

results.title: Colombia and Venezuela
results.creator_credit: Sterling Educational Films and William L. Claiborne
results.brief_description: Among the most advanced on the continent, these Caribbean countries still suffer from the ills that continue to plague all of Latin America. One crop economics, a population explosion and unequal land distribution are certainly negative influences but real changes are being made as the economy continues to expand and diversify.

results.title: Colloids (elementary principles)
results.creator_credit: ERPI Classroom Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Among the examples of colloidal suspension studied in this film are: fog (liquid in gas); whipped cream (gas in liquid); clay and india ink (solid in liquid); smoke (solid in gas); and mayonaise (liquid in liquid). Failure to settle is explained by Brownian movement, protective films, and charges on particles. The Cottrell process of smoke precipitation concludes the film.

results.title: Colloids
results.brief_description: A description of the properties of colloidal suspensions, concentrating on the means of preventing coagulation by attraction between particles. Examples are taken from everyday occurrence including the activity of detergents on oils.

results.title: Colloids
results.creator_credit: Cammell Hudson Productions and Piers Jessop
results.brief_description: An explanation of the behaviour of particles suspended in a medium of which commonplace examples are milk, clouds and stained glass. Describes the factors involved in colloid formation. Discusses the importance of colloid chemistry to industry, the understanding of which is an essential part of today’s technology.

results.title: Collins Street Walk
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School, Tony Evans and Paul Connor
results.brief_description: Children from Fitzroy Primary School are shown on the National Trust’s Collins Street Walk. They then use the graphics facility at Swinburne Institute’s computer installation to create an animated film based on the experience. Suitable for upper primary level.
